Twenty chapters of Theta Nu
Epsilon have been suspended in the
past few years according to a report by its Grand Secretary to Dean
Thomas Arkle Clark, at the Interfraternity Conference held in New
York recently. Eight chapters have
been suspended because they did
not function in accordance with the
policy df the grand council.

ENGINEERING STUDENTS
MAKE MUD PIES
Visitors in the Materials Testing
Laboratory are surprised to find
young men, with their sleeves rolled
up, playing with little piles of mud,
rolling balls of the same material in
their hands, and pressing it into little brass forms. Upon closer investigation, one finds that these
young men, who are engineering
upperclassmen, are not engaged in
the Childish sport of making "mud
pies" merely to while the time away,
but are engaged in scientific research. The seeming "piles of mud"
are cements mixed in varying proportions, and the molds are the
standard cement briquette forms
for the tension test as . approved by
the American Society of Testing
Materials. This laboratory work is
part of the course in materials of
engineering, and is conducted by
1\Ir. Frank W. Kouwenhouven,
himself a research worker of some
renown.

ENGINEERING STUDENTS
MAKE MUD PIES
Visitors in the Materials Testing
Laboratory are surprised to find
young men, with their sleeves rolled
up, playing with little piles of mud,
rolling balls of the same material in
their hands, and pressing it into little brass forms. Upon closer investigation, one finds that these
young men, who are engineering
upperclassmen, are not engaged in
the Childish sport of making "mud
pies" merely to while the time away,
but are engaged in scientific research. The seeming "piles of mud"
are cements mixed in varying proportions, and the molds are the
standard cement briquette forms
for the tension test as . approved by
the American Society of Testing
Materials. This laboratory work is
part of the course in materials of
engineering, and is conducted by
1\Ir. Frank W. Kouwenhouven,
himself a research worker of some
renown.
